Comments
Campus police is always around, in and out of the buildings.
Check out the Student Leadership Department's website.

We have a designated Student Activity Hour, so that many of the students and faculty can attend, without missing class. There are Sorority and Fraternity Clubs, Poetry, Art, Music, Religious, Multicultural, Ethnic, Women-focused, Law, Hip-Hop, Jazz and Journalism Clubs, literary magazines and newspapers, Student Union, Student Leadership, Study Abroad/Scholarship programs, a full-sized, well-equipped gym, with a pool, a Ping Pong table and a Rock-climbing Wall, Art Exhibits, themed parties/events off-campus, conferences and keynote speakers. There are too many clubs/organizations for me to list.
It's great for any student interested in attending, even Senior Citizens. I like the diversity of the university.

If you have trouble finding a club to join or something to do at this school, then you're not looking. From Bake Sales to movies, Talent Shows to Art Exhibits, poetry to theatrical productions...there is something for everyone. I joined my schoolmates IN the 83rd Annual Bud Billiken Parade, this year.

There are vending machines all over campus, in nearly every building. There is a Subway restaurant, in addition to another restaurant that serves a small variety of meal choices, along with sandwiches and desserts. The school bookstore also sells a nice variety of drinks and snack food, including a selection of healthy cookies that taste rather good.
I don't live on campus, so I cannot rate it fairly.

I'm still learning about my school, but so far, the expectations are the same across the board...a solid education you can be proud of. To help every student be successful, the University has several programs in place, for those who want, or need, it.

Every college student should know what Credits you already have, what and how many Credits you WILL need, and which Credits will transfer to another program or school. Check this out for yourself, in addition to working with an Academic Advisor. Also, check to see what work experience or training you already have, that includes volunteer work AND high school courses and activities, that you may be able to get college credit for...less classes taken, less money spent.

NEIU was recently rated one of the cheapest 4-year universities to attend. NEIU is very active in the community. NEIU has a LOT of student-centered activities available and it has been a great experience for me.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {111558=The campus has a very safe feel about it. Once, I was leaving the library at about 8 o'clock at night after a serious study session and I expected to be freaked out when going outside after dark, but the campus felt really safe. The lights made everything brighter and feel ok. We also have these pillars scattered around the campus that have a button in the middle. If there's ever an emergency, you would press the button and help would arrive soon., 124174=i go on the November 1 and 2nd when they have the dia de os muertos event atte school., 254461=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 221040=Activity hour (when most clubs/activities/Greek life meet) is on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 3:05 - 4:05 pm.}

textAfterTable: Antonio from Skokie, IL 02/24/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 63 Categories Comments Bang for the buck NEIU has a reputation for providing affordable education for many years now. The school is one of the cheapest forms of higher education in the Chicago land area. Recently it was ranked amongst the highest schools with the less amount of graduates leaving without debt. Am enjoying being here Student life at NEIU is complicated as the school is a commuter school. Needless to say many friendly people attended this university and there’s always something to get involved in. Am learning a lot Northeastern Illinois University is filled with delightful professors that go beyond the basic expectations in helping student’s succeed in their classes. All of my professors have flexible offer hours, and tutors are available free of charge by the university in the library.
